verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of the wilderness <WH4057> of the sea. <WH3220> As whirlwinds <WH5492> in the South <WH5045> sweep <WH2498> through, <WH935> it comes from the wilderness, <WH4057> from an awesome <WH3372> land. <WH776>

A grievous <WH7186> vision <WH2380> is declared <WH5046> to me. <WH898> The treacherous man deals treacherously, <WH898> and the destroyer <WH7703> destroys. <WH7703> Go up, <WH5927> Elam; <WH5867> attack! <WH6696> I have stopped <WH7673> all of Media <WH4074>'s sighing. <WH585>

Therefore my thighs <WH4975> are filled <WH4390> with anguish. <WH2479> Pains <WH2479> have taken hold <WH270> on me, <WH6735> like the pains of a woman in labor. <WH3205> I am in so much pain <WH5753> that I can't <WH8085> hear. I so am dismayed <WH926> that I can't <WH7200> see.
My heart <WH3824> flutters. <WH8582> Horror <WH6427> has frightened <WH1204> me. <WH5399> The twilight that I desired <WH2837> has been turned <WH7760> into trembling for me. <WH2731>
They prepare <WH6186> the table. <WH7979> They set <WH6186> the watch. <WH6822> They eat. <WH398> They drink. <WH8354> Rise <WH6965> up, <WH8269> you princes, oil <WH4886> the shield! <WH4043>
For the Lord <WH136> said <WH559> to me, <WH3212> "Go, set <WH5975> a watchman. <WH6822> Let him declare <WH5046> what he sees. <WH7200>

When he sees <WH7200> a troop, <WH7393> horsemen <WH6571> in pairs, <WH6776> a troop <WH7393> of donkeys, <WH2543> a troop <WH7393> of camels, <WH1581> he shall listen <WH7181> diligently <WH7182> with great <WH7227> attentiveness. <WH7182>"

He cried <WH7121> like a lion: <WH738> "Lord, <WH136> I stand <WH5975> continually <WH8548> on the watchtower <WH4707> in the daytime, <WH3119> and every night <WH3915> I stay <WH5324> at my post. <WH4931>

Behold, <WH935> here comes a troop <WH7393> of men, <WH376> horsemen <WH6571> in pairs. <WH6776>" He answered, <WH6030> "Fallen, <WH5307> fallen <WH5307> is Babylon; <WH894> and all the engraved images <WH6456> of her gods <WH430> are broken <WH7665> to the ground. <WH776>

You are my threshing, <WH4098> and the grain <WH1121> of my floor! <WH1637>" That which I have heard <WH8085> from Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> I have declared to you. <WH5046>
The burden <WH4853> of Dumah. <WH1746> One calls <WH7121> to me out of Seir, <WH8165> "Watchman, <WH8104> what of the night? <WH3915> Watchman, <WH8104> what of the night? <WH3915>"
The watchman <WH8104> said, <WH559> "The morning <WH1242> comes, <WH857> and also the night. <WH3915> If you will inquire, <WH1158> inquire. <WH1158> Come <WH857> back again. <WH7725>"
The burden <WH4853> on Arabia. <WH6152> In the forest <WH3293> in Arabia <WH6152> you will lodge, <WH3885> you caravans <WH736> of Dedanites. <WH1720>

They brought <WH857> water <WH4325> to him <WH7125> who was thirsty. <WH6771> The inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776> of Tema <WH8485> met <WH6923> the fugitives <WH5074> with their bread. <WH3899>

For they fled <WH5074> away from <WH6440> the swords, <WH2719> from <WH6440> the drawn <WH5203> sword, <WH2719> from <WH6440> the bent <WH1869> bow, <WH7198> and from <WH6440> the heat <WH3514> of battle. <WH4421>
For the Lord <WH136> said <WH559> to me, <WH8141> "Within a year, as a worker bound by contract <WH7916> would count <WH8141> it, <WH3519> all the glory of Kedar <WH6938> will fail, <WH3615>

and the residue <WH7605> of the number <WH4557> of the archers, <WH7198> the mighty men <WH1368> of the children <WH1121> of Kedar, <WH6938> will be few; <WH4591> for Yahweh, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> has spoken it. <WH1696>"
